titlestmt.titleproper: Henry Trantham papers, Inclusive: 1894-1962, undated, Bulk:1921-1950, undated

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Henry Trantham papers consist of documents generated and collected by Henry Trantham. The papers contain correspondence, administrative and academic materials, and other loose materials related to Baylor University and the Greek and Classics Departments, the Southwest Athletic Conference, and the Rhodes Scholarship program.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Henry Trantham was born on 1882 March 10 in Camden, South Carolina. He received a Bachelor of Arts and Master of Arts Degree from Wake Forrest College in 1900 and 1901, and attended the University of Oxford through the Rhodes Scholarship from 1905 to 1908. Trantham taught at the Oak Ridge Institute in Oak Ridge, North Carolina, from 1902 to 1905, and served as the principal at the Newnan High School in Newnan, Georgia, from 1908 to 1910. He was a professor of Greek and Roman History, Twentieth Century History, and Greek language at Baylor University from 1910 to 1958, serving as the Greek Department head from 1910 to 1950, and Classics Department chairman from 1950 to 1958. Trantham retired in 1958 and died on 1962 February 19.

Henry Trantham served on multiple committees and boards. He was the Baylor University faculty representative to the Southwest Athletic Conference from 1916 to 1923, and from 1925 to 1941. Trantham was the president of the Southwest Athletic Conference from 1918 to 1919, and from 1938 to 1941, and in that position he assisted in the establishment of the Cotton Bowl Association. He was the secretary for the Rhodes Scholarship Selection committee from 1919 to 1939. Trantham was a member of the Board of Commissioners, City of Waco, Texas, from 1931 to 1933. He was a member of the Philosophical Society of Texas, the Texas Classical Association, the Philosopher’s Club of Waco, Texas, and Phi Beta Kappa. At Baylor University, Trantham was the editor of “The Diamond Jubilee, 1845-1920”.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Henry Trantham papers contain six series, organized mostly chronologicaly. Most of the materials are handwritten in pencil. It contains correspondence related to the Southwest Athletic Conference from 1921 to 1941; correspondence related to Baylor University administration, the Classics Department and the Diamond Jubilee; correspondence related to the Rhodes Scholarship, in the context of Rhodes Scholarship alumni and the selection process for new Rhodes Scholars; and personal correspondence. The correspondence was generated by Henry Trantham and by others, and includes drafts of letters frequently written on the back of lesson plans and student exams. It also contains Baylor University grade books for Greek and History classes from 1910 to 1958, primarily in bound book form. It contains lesson plans for Greek language classes and History classes. There are newsletters and materials related to the Rhodes Scholarship, from 1920 to 1958. Meeting minutes, team rosters, newspaper clippings and other materials related to the Southwest Athletic Conference are also included. There are a few receipts and other personal materials.

The Henry Trantham papers, particularly the correspondence series, provides useful information about the Southwest Athletic Conference, particularly information about team rosters, constitutional discussions and eligibility issues. The correspondence and Baylor Academic Materials series provide useful Greek language lesson plans, which are both in English and Greek.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Henry Trantham papers were not organized prior to processing, beyond a few folders containing correspondence and lesson plans. The collection had an initial inventory from 1971.

The Henry Trantham papers are organized into six series: I. Correspondence, II. Baylor Grade Books, III. Baylor Academic Materials, IV. Non-Baylor Academic Materials, V. Athletic Materials, VI. Personal Materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is restricted. Please see an archivist for details.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Trantham papers, Accession #207, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Michael Rebman. Released on 2012-12-20.

relatedmaterial.head: Related references
relatedmaterial.bibref: Garrett, James Leo, Jr. The Teacher’s Yolk: Studies in Memory of Henry Trantham. Baylor University Press: Waco, Texas, 1964, pp. 13-16.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series includes correspondence to and from Henry Trantham related to Baylor University, the Rhodes Scholarship and the Southwest Athletic Conference. The material is in fair condition: the sheets are yellowed, and many items are facsimile and carbon copies on thin and worn paper.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series contains 20 grade books and typewritten grade sheets for Greek language and various History classes at Baylor University. The material is in good condition: the books are starting to yellow.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series includes lesson plans, midterm and final exams, and class notes related to Greek language, History, Physics and Chemistry classes at Baylor University, along with administrative papers and other materials related to Baylor University. The material is in fair condition: the sheets are yellowed, and many items are facsimile and carbon copies on thin and worn paper.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series contains twelve Rhodes Scholarship-related newsletters, two pamphlets related to the Rhodes Scholarship, an Oxford University Address Book, one oversized photograph and three bound essays. The material is in good condition: some of the items are yellowed and show wear on the edges.

did.unittitle: Oxford and the Rhodes Scholarship Pamphlet
The Political Satire of the Non-Juror

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series contains athletic reports, rosters, a Cotton Bowl newspaper clipping scrapbook and other athletic materials. The material is in good condition: some of the items are yellowed.

did.unittitle: Southwest Athletic Conference Constitution and By-Laws

Southwest Athletic Conference Constitution and By-Laws
Baylor Athletic Rosters: Track, Swimming, Tennis, Golf

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series contains musical recital programs, handwritten notes and smoking schedules, receipts and other personal materials. The material is in good condition: some of the items are yellowed.

did.unittitle: Personal Materials: The Monthly Supplement, International Who’s Who
